description: Following the installation of specific security updates (KB-5035858, KB-5035856, KB-5035855, KB-5035854, KB-5035853, KB-5035845) related to the Windows kernel, users may experience unauthorized access to system-level functionalities due to an elevation of privilege vulnerability. The affected builds include Windows 10 and 11 versions ranging from 10.0.10240.20526 to 10.0.22631.3296. System administrators should be aware that this issue might manifest as unexpected behavior during user sessions, such as unauthorized file modifications or application launches without consent. Immediate attention is advised to ensure that users' workflows are not compromised by actions performed by unprivileged accounts gaining elevated privileges.
